parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To be over-anxious; with acc: To be anxious about, distracted; I care for. From merimna; to be anxious about.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From proseuchomai; prayer; by implication, an oratory.
Supplication, prayer, entreaty. From deomai; a petition.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Thankfulness, gratitude; giving of thanks, thanksgiving. From eucharistos; gratitude; actively, grateful language.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A petition, request. From aiteo; a thing asked or an asking.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
